Tuesday, May 15, 2007























Olympic bomber taunts victims from prison
Victims of Eric Rudolph, the anti-abortion extremist who pulled off a series of bombings across the South, say he is taunting them from deep within the nation's most secure federal prison, and authorities say there is little they can do to stop him.
FULL STORY


























NANCY GRACE Airs on Headline PRIME, 8 p.m. ET
"Nancy Grace" is television's only justice-themed interview and debate show. Nancy Grace challenges guests
on the most controversial and high-profile legal issues of the day by drawing on her unique perspective
as a former violent crimes prosecutor and as a crime victim herself.  Send your questions and comments.





















Gun-toting Spector like Elmer Fudd
A waitress testifying Monday in music producer Phil Spector's murder trial said he once escorted her and a friend out of his mansion while carrying a rifle or shotgun.
FULL STORY






Ex-trooper indicted in '65 slaying 
An Alabama grand jury has returned a sealed indictment in the fatal shooting of a black man by an Alabama state trooper during a 1965 civil rights protest.
FULL STORY






'Skinny Dom' gets split verdict 
A federal jury convicted a 65-year-old mobster of racketeering and conspiring to murder a husband and wife stickup team who robbed mob hangouts.
FULL STORY






Cop killer's last wish granted
Hundreds of homeless people in Nashville, Tennessee, ate well Wednesday evening -- all in the name of a man who the state put to death just hours earlier.
FULL STORY
